entry.title: Kubota+ (2024)
entry.content:
Accelerating Seafloor Uplift of Submarine Caldera Near Sofugan Volcano, Japan, Resolved by Distant Tsunami Recordings

  • We revealed the source kinematics of enigmatic tsunamis excited near Torishima on 8 October 2023 with remote (>âˆ¼600 km) tsunami data
  • Its tsunami source was identified as repetitive seafloor uplift at the same location with gradually increasing amounts for later events
  • This unique feature of the accelerating caldera uplift within a few hours was brought about by the volcanic unrest of a submarine caldera

entry.title: Sandanbata+ (2024)
entry.content:
Tsunami wave amplification by repetitive 14 tsunami generations within 1.5 hours!

  • On 8 October 2023 (UTC), enigmatic tsunamis up to âˆ¼60 cm were recorded along broad Japanese coasts without large earthquakes.
  • Analysis of stacked tsunami waveform data shows >10 events intermittently caused tsunamis for âˆ¼1.5 hr with T-phase and seismic excitation.
  • Larger events later in the sequence occurred with intervals similar to the wave period, amplifying the tsunami waves in the later phase.

entry.title: Sandanbata & Saito (2024)
entry.content:
Attempt to quantify the magma pressure using remotely observed volcanic tsunami waves

  • Non-double-couple earthquakes with seismic magnitudes of 5.2â€“5.3 recurred in the vicinity of a submarine caldera near Kita-Ioto Island
  • A mechanical model of trapdoor faulting based on tsunami data of the 2008 earthquake infers pre-seismic overpressure in a magma reservoir
  • Uncertainty in fault geometry varies our estimate of pre-seismic overpressure (5â€“20 MPa) and co-seismic pressure drop ratio (10%â€“40%)

See a brief summary of this paper in the website of Earthquake Research Institute, the University of Tokyo.

åŒ—ç¡«é»„å³¶ã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ‡ãƒ©ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ‰ã‚¢æ–­å±¤ç ´å£Šï¼šæ´¥æ³¢è¨˜éŒ²ã¨åŠ›å­¦çš„åœ°éœ‡ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã‚’ç”¨ã„ãŸã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ‡ãƒ©ç›´ä¸‹ã®ãƒã‚°ãƒéå‰°åœ§ã®å®šé‡åŒ–ã¸ã®è©¦ã¿

entry.title: Assistant Professor
entry.content:
ğŸŒ

2023å¹´5æœˆ1æ—¥ä»˜ã§ï¼Œæ±äº¬å¤§å­¦åœ°éœ‡ç ”ç©¶æ‰€ã®åŠ©æ•™ã¨ã—ã¦ç€ä»»ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ

I was appointed as an Assisitant Professor at Earthquake Research Institute, the University of Tokyo. As a member of Dr. Shing Watadaâ€™s (Associate Professor) laboratory, I will keep going to seek for better understand of volcanos, tsunamis, and earthquakes, by using data analyis and numerical modeling of the phenomena.

entry.title: Sandanbata+ (2023)
entry.content:
Found the 2nd case of tsunami events caused by â€œtrapdoorâ€ faulting at submarine calderas!

This study suggests that peculiar tsunamis from Curtis and Cheeseman Island, north of New Zealand, were generated by submarine â€œtrapdoor faultingâ€ mechanism in a submerged caldera near the islands. This was inferred from our combined tsunami and seismic analyses for the 2017 earthquake.

ã€Œãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ‰ã‚¢æ–­å±¤ç ´å£Šã€ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦æ´¥æ³¢ã‚’å¼•ãèµ·ã“ã™æµ·åº•ã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ‡ãƒ©ã®æ–°ãŸã«ç™ºè¦‹ï¼ˆä¸–ç•Œã§äºŒã¤ç›®ï¼‰

(2022)ã§åˆã‚ã¦æ˜ã‚‰ã‹ã«ãªã£ãŸï¼Œå¤§ããªæ´¥æ³¢ã‚’å¼•ãèµ·ã“ã™æµ·åº•ã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ‡ãƒ©ã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹ã€Œãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ‰ã‚¢æ–­å±¤ç ´å£Šã€ã¨å‘¼ã°ã‚Œã‚‹æµ·åº•ç«å±±ç¾è±¡ãŒï¼Œãƒ‹ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ¼ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ‰åŒ—æ–¹æ²–ã®ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹å³¶å‘¨è¾ºã®æµ·åº•ã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ‡ãƒ©ã§ã‚‚ç™ºç”Ÿã—ï¼ŒåŒæ§˜ã«å¤§ããªæ´¥æ³¢ã‚’å¼•ãèµ·ã“ã—ã¦ã„ãŸã“ã¨ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼ä¸Šè¿°ã®å…ˆè¡Œç ”ç©¶ã¨åˆã‚ã›ã¦ï¼Œç•°ãªã‚‹äºŒã¤ã®æµ·åº•ã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ‡ãƒ©ã§ã®é¡ä¼¼ã™ã‚‹ç«å±±ç¾è±¡ã®ç™ºè¦‹ã‹ã‚‰ï¼Œâ€ç‰¹ç•°â€ãªç¾è±¡ã¨è€ƒãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ãŸæµ·åº•ç«å±±ç¾è±¡ãŒï¼Œã“ã‚Œã¾ã§è€ƒãˆã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ãŸã‚ˆã‚Šã‚‚â€æ™®éâ€çš„ãªç«å±±ç¾è±¡ã§ã‚ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã‚ã‹ã£ã¦ãã¾ã—ãŸï¼

entry.title: Sandanbata & Saito
entry.content:
Presentation information/ç™ºè¡¨æƒ…å ±

Title:
Sub-decadal volcanic tsunamis due to submarine trapdoor faulting at Sumisu caldera in the Izu-Bonin arc Authors Osamu Sandanbata, Shingo Watada, Kenji Satake, Hiroo Kanamori, Luis Rivera, and Zhongwen Zhan. Conference IAVCEI 2023 Scientific Assembly Place Rotorua, New Zealand Abstract # 401 Type Oral

entry.title: ECR Plenary Speaker
entry.content:
ğŸŒ
I was honored to be selected as one of the four speakers of Early-Career Researcher (ECR) Plenary Session at IAVCEI 2023 Scientific Assembly at Rotorua, New Zealand. The title of the plenary talk was â€œTrapdoor faulting at submarine calderas in Japan and New Zealand: Its potential for volcanic tsunami generationâ€. It couldnâ€™t be more honorable that I presented the research I had spent ~5 years in front of hundreds of great volcanologists from all over the world.

ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ
2023å¹´1â€“2æœˆã«ãƒ‹ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ¼ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ»ãƒ­ãƒˆãƒ«ã‚¢ã§é–‹å‚¬ã•ã‚Œã‚‹IAVCEI 2023 Scientific Assemblyã§ã®Early-Career Researcher (ECR) Plenary Sessionã¨ã„ã†è‹¥æ‰‹ç ”ç©¶è€…å››åé™å®šã®åŸºèª¿è¬›æ¼”ç™»å£‡è€…ã«é¸ã‚“ã§ã„ãŸã ãï¼Œ2æœˆ3æ—¥ã«ãƒ—ãƒ¬ã‚¼ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚’è¡Œã„ã¾ã—ãŸï¼â€Trapdoor faulting at submarine calderas in Japan and New Zealand: Its potential for volcanic tsunami generationâ€œã¨ã„ã†ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«ã§ï¼Œãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ‰ã‚¢æ–­å±¤ç ´å£Šã¨ã„ã†æµ·åº•ã‚«ãƒ«ãƒ‡ãƒ©ã§ç™ºç”Ÿã™ã‚‹ç«å±±ç¾è±¡ã«ã‚ˆã‚‹æ´¥æ³¢ç™ºç”Ÿã«ã¤ã„ã¦ï¼Œä¿¯ç°çš„ã«ç´¹ä»‹ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼ä¸–ç•Œå„åœ°ã‹ã‚‰é›†çµã—ãŸæ•°ç™¾äººã®ç«å±±å­¦è€…ã®å‰ã§ï¼Œäº”å¹´ä»¥ä¸Šã‹ã‘ã¦ããŸç ”ç©¶ã‚’ç´¹ä»‹ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã®ä¸Šãªã„è²´é‡ãªæ™‚é–“ã‚’éã”ã™ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã—ãŸï¼
